title: NASA Earth science hosted payload set for launch on Intelsat satellite
summary: The upcoming launch of a NASA Earth science instrument on a commercial communications satellite illustrates the promise of, but also the problems with, hosted payloads.

title: Space Development Agency’s first satellite launch hailed as model
summary: The successful launch of Tranche 0 satellites took place 27 months after SDA, an agency under the U.S. Space Force, ordered the satellites, drawing praise from senior officials.

title: Space Force embraces unconventional ways to attract and retain talent
summary: As the smallest branch of the U.S. military with a high demand for technical expertise, the Space Force has embraced unconventional ways to attract and retain people in key career fields.

title: A New Zealand company has started flying a rocket-powered spaceplane
summary: "Once we get our certification, we're allowed to fly as frequently as we want."

title: Dawn flies rocket-powered spaceplane
summary: Dawn Aerospace completed its first series of rocket-powered flights last week of Mk-II Aurora spaceplane.
